|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 512 |ram1chip = Micron;MT41K128M16JT-125:K; |ram1_num = 2 |ram2type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram2type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram2spd = <!-- 3400,3333,3300,3200,3100,3000,2800,2666,2600,2400,2133,2000,1866,1600,1066,1333,800 --> |ram2size = 128 |ram2chip = Winbond;W631GG6KB-12; |ram2_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Quantenna;QT3840BC;Quantenna Communications, QT3840BC-ES, AA01A0D0, E01008, 1336; |rad1chip2 = Quantenna;QT2518B;QT2518B, AA00A0D1, A01253, 1350; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 4 |rad1rxchains = 4 |rad1sstreams = 4 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad1ac = 1733 |rad1n = 600 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5
|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Qualcomm Atheros;QCA9880;QCA9880-BR4A, NHU572.002B, 1350, TAIWAN; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = 600 |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This device has probably been renamed as the [[Linksys E8400]] for marketing purposes.
Text including "ENWA04" appears to be silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. <small>'''WNC''' manuf?</small>
Per the FCC photos.. *The NAND is marked w/ 3VE17 NW264 (FBGA code NW264: [http://www.micron.com/parts/nand-flash/mass-storage/mt29f2g08abbeah4?pc=%7B1D4348BA-3AE0-4BB5-8E1F-76C12AEDFEFC%7D MT29F2G08ABBEAH4:E, 2Gbit SLC NAND]), this conflicts with the data added by another user - if someone has photos plz add *Each of the IPQ8x's RAM chips is marked w/ 3VK77 D9PTK (FBGA code D9PTK: [http://www.micron.com/parts/dram/ddr3-sdram/mt41k128m16jt-125?pc=%7B338582DE-C8D6-4594-91B4-B3E86A5D5374%7D MT41K128M16JT-125:K, 2Gb DDR3-1600 SDRAM]).
{{WiFiCert|WFA55152|07/09/2014}} :The WFA certification indicates this device will be using ''[[Quantenna]]'' + ''[[QCA]]'' silicon.. which the FCC photos indicate it is indeed using. <small> According to the [https://www.linksys.com/us/support-article?articleNum=156231 ''Product comparison chart of the Linksys EA7500, EA8500, E8350 and E8400''] from Linksys, the E8350 supports wireless bridge mode but cannot operate as a wireless repeater/extender. </small>
===Specifications=== *CPU: [[Qualcomm]] IPQ8064 Internet Processor (Dual-Core @1.4 GHz) *RAM: ''Micron'' MT41K128M16JT-125 (D9PTK) (DDR3L, x4/x8/x16) *Small Flash: M25P80 (SPI 5.0), ''Macronix'' MX25U3235F (4MB) *NAND Flash: ''Micron'' MT29F1G08ABBDAH4 (NW302 [VFBGA63]) :NAND Controller ID: 0x4030, NAND Device ID: 0x1580a12c *WLAN1: [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA9880-BR4A (3x3 MIMO) [https://itw01.com/GUDQEY6.html DS] *WLAN2: [[Quantenna]] QT3840BC/QT2518B (802.11ac 4x4 MIMO) *Switch: [[Qualcomm Atheros]] QCA8337-AL3C (7-port GbE) *Bootinfo: console=ttyHSL1,115200n8 ubi.mtd=rootfs root=mtd:ubi_rootfs *Firmware: Build_for_Belkin_Linksys_AC2350_k3.4.0_2014-04-16_lke_8.9.0_r227 163_b16
==Links of Interest== ===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32535-linksys-e8350-ac2400-dual-band-gigabit-wi-fi-router-reviewed On '''SmallNetBuilder''']
